channel.title: Frock Flicks
channel.copyright: copyright 2007 Trystan L. Bass, Kendra Van Cleve, Sarah Lorraine Goodman
channel.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
channel.itunes:summary: Ever watch a historical movie and wonder "what the heck are they wearing?" We've studied the real clothing, and we love to pick apart Hollywood's idea of historical costume. But it's not just about history, it's also about symbolism, style, and more. Join us in the theater to talk about fabulous films, fantastic costumes, and what it all means.
channel.description: Ever watch a historical movie and wonder "what the heck are they wearing?" We've studied the real clothing, and we love to pick apart Hollywood's idea of historical costume. But it's not just about history, it's also about symbolism, style, and more. Join us in the theater to talk about fabulous films, fantastic costumes, and what it all means.

itunes:owner.itunes:name: Trystan L. Bass, Kendra Van Cleve, Sarah Lorraine Goodman

item.title: Sofia Coppola's Marie Antoinette
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: A metaphor of 1980s consumer consumption and post-punk isolation, plus hardcore costume porn. Remember, what happens in Le Petit Trianon, stays in Le Petit Trianon.
item.description: A metaphor of 1980s consumer consumption and post-punk isolation, plus hardcore costume porn. Remember, what happens in Le Petit Trianon, stays in Le Petit Trianon.
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, marie antoinette, sofia coppola, punk

item.title: Shekhar Kapur's Elizabeth
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Is the Virgin Queen really a virgin? Does it matter? And check out the puffy pants on the studly dude who'll later be flying around in a police call box. Bollywood meets Shakespeare in England's first golden age.
item.description: Is the Virgin Queen really a virgin? Does it matter? And check out the pants on that studly dude who'll later be flying around in a police call box. Bollywood meets Shakespeare in England's first golden age.
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, elizabeth i, shekhar kapur, cate blanchett, renaissance

item.title: Justin Chadwick's The Other Boleyn Girl
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Ah, the great clash of history versus historical fiction! A best-selling book that toys liberally with the facts of Henry VIII and the two Boleyn sisters gets blown up on the big screen. Is it even more historically inaccurate than the novel? Does it matter? You may be surprised at what we think...
item.description: Ah, the great clash of history versus historical fiction! A best-selling book that toys liberally with the facts of Henry VIII and the two Boleyn sisters gets blown up on the big screen. Is it even more historically inaccurate than the novel? Does it matter? You may be surprised at what we think...
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, henry viii, anne boleyn, mary boleyn, tudor, natalie portman, scarlett johansson

item.title: Wait, Wait, Don't Frock Me
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Instead of watching a movie, we quiz a live, studio audience about costume trivia! Tune into the gang at Costume-Con 26, where we boldly went where no historical cosutmers had podcasted before. NPR fans, frequent eBayers, and Showtime snarkers may get a giggle out of this episode.
item.description: Instead of watching a movie, we quiz a live, studio audience about costume trivia! Tune into the gang at Costume-Con 26, where we boldly went where no historical cosutmers had podcasted before. NPR fans, frequent eBayers, and Showtime snarkers may get a giggle out of this episode.
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, humor, trivia, star trek, ebay, tudor, limerick, jane austen

item.title: Mira Nair's Vanity Fair
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Regency England gets an Indian flair in this adaption of William Makepeace Thackeray's novel. But this isn't just another Bollywood-ization -- the Indian themes are carefully woven into the story and visual effects. This could be the anti-Austen with nary a dull muslin gown in sight.
item.description: Regency England gets an Indian flair in this adaption of William Makepeace Thackeray's novel. But this isn't just another Bollywood-ization -- the Indian themes are carefully woven into the story and visual effects. This could be the anti-Austen with nary a dull muslin gown in sight.
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, vanity fair, mira nair, reese witherspoon, regency, bollywood

item.title: Charles Shyer's The Affair of the Necklace
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Fabulous 18th century costumes plus bad casting makes 'The Affair of the Necklace' (2001) a contradictory endeavor. Listen as we analyze the costumes, praise Adrien Brody's towel, and ramble on about historical underwear.
item.description: Fabulous 18th century costumes plus bad casting makes 'The Affair of the Necklace' (2001) a contradictory endeavor. Listen as we analyze the costumes, praise Adrien Brody's towel, and ramble on about historical underwear.
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, design, history, criticism, art, marie antoinette, 18th century, affair of the necklace

item.title: Neil Jordan's The Borgias
item.itunes:author: The Frock Flickers
item.itunes:summary: Power and intrigue at the Vatican during the Italian Renaissance. Listen as we geek out on shoes and eyeglasses, discuss historical body ideals, and bemoan the shy guys!
item.description: Power and intrigue at the Vatican during the Italian Renaissance. Listen as we geek out on shoes and eyeglasses, discuss historical body ideals, and bemoan the shy guys!
item.itunes:keywords: movies, film costume, television costume, design, history, criticism, art, borgias, vatican, italian renaissance
